intro: Phalangium minimum, commonly known as the lesser phalangium, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Phalangium minimum is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
